intro.description:
This cheat sheet will demonstrate how to first detect and then integrate peaks. These are two distinct processes in this software.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help (?) button in the top right corner.

item.title: Select Data Analysis
item.description: Switch to correct perspective if you haven't already.

subitem.label: Select "Window->Switch Perspective" from the main menu and choose "Data Analysis (Main)" in order to open the general chromatography perspective

item.title: Open File
item.description:
Use the Data Explorer on the left to navigate to your files. Double click to open one.
This example assumes you have a mass selective detector (MSD) but the procedure is similar for others.

item.title: Peak Detection
item.description: To detect peaks in your chromatogram with MSD signals:

subitem.label: Right-click in the chromatogram and select "Peak Detector->First Derivative".
You can use (default) system options for this example. Click "Complete" to execute the operation.

item.title: Peak Integration
item.description: To get the area below the peaks:

subitem.label: Right-click in the chromatogram and select "Peak Integrator->Peak Integrator Trapezoid".
You can use (default) system options for this example. Click "Complete" to execute the operation.
In the main toolbar choose "Peaks->Peak/Scan List".

item.title: Summary
item.description: Notice how both peak detection and integration offer multiple choices. You can recombine and compare them individually.
